Predictor::State

Predictor::State Class Reference

The primary data structure used by Planner, this class stores the predicted reward and terminal-state distribution for a nonterminal state. More...

Detailed Description

The primary data structure used by Planner, this class stores the predicted reward and terminal-state distribution for a nonterminal state.

As a StatePrediction, it exports this information to other StatePrediction objects, and it exports this data outside the enclosing Planner via the StateActionModel interface.

Definition at line 141 of file predictor.hh.

Member Function Documentation

void Predictor::State::add_predecessor ( const StateWeakRef &  pred,
double  probability 
) [virtual]

Informs this StatePrediction to backup reward and transition distribution changes to the given predecessor, weighted by the given probability.

Note that this method is used to update the probability for an existing predecessor.

Parameters:
pred A State that can transition to this StatePrediction
probability The probability with which pred transitions to this StatePrediction

Implements Predictor::StatePrediction.

const ModelBasedStatePolicyRef &  policy,
StateWeakRef &  ref,
StatePredictionWeakRef *  ptr 
) [static]

The caller should invoke the initialize method as soon as a pointer to the new State has been added to the predictions hash table, to avoid unbounded recursion.

Parameters:
predictor The Predictor object that is creating and will contain this State.
policy The ModelBasedStatePolicy object for which this State object will perform the corresponding prediction.
ref A StateWeakRef that should be assigned the new State before it initializes.
ptr An optional StatePredictionWeakRef that should be assigned the new State before it initializes.

const EffectDistribution & Predictor::State::effects (  )  const [virtual]

Returns:
The predicted distribution of effects for the modeled state and action. Note that the pointers in this data structure are only guaranteed to remain valid while they exist in the data structure. The caller may subscribe to this StateActionModel to be notified about changes to this structure.

Implements StateActionModel.

void Predictor::State::heapify ( queue_t  idx  )  [protected]

If this State is in the appropriate priority queue of its enclosing Predictor, then enforce the heap invariant for the subtree rooted by this State, assuming that the subtrees rooted at each children is a heap.

Parameters:
idx Which priority queue to heapify

Definition at line 383 of file predictor.cc.

References insert_heapify(), m_error_bounds, m_heap_indices, m_predictor, and m_this.

void Predictor::State::initialize (  ) 

Complete the initialization of this object's data members.

This initialization can't occur in the constructor, since it could lead to unbounded recursion. This way, the Predictor containing this State can assign this object's pointer to a hash table, preventing it from trying to construct a second State for the same state_t pointer.

Definition at line 224 of file predictor.cc.

References m_action, m_mdp_state, m_policy, propagate_mdp_change(), and vector_map_find().

double  p 
) const [virtual]

Parameters:

void Predictor::State::zero_bound ( queue_t  idx  )  [inline]

Resets the appropriate bound on Bellman error to zero.

May only be called if this State is at the head of the corresponding priority queue. Removes this State from that priority queue.

Parameters:
idx Which error to zero out.

double Predictor::State::m_r [private]

Definition at line 272 of file predictor.hh.

Referenced by predict_return(), propagate_reward_change(), and reward().

SuccessorsContainer Predictor::State::m_successors [private]

A mapping, stored as a sorted vector, from state_t pointers (obtained from the successor_probabilities() method of an MDPStateAction) to pairs containing first the corresponding StatePrediction object in this Predictor and second the successor probability.

A NULL StatePredictionRef serves as a proxy for a self-reference.

Definition at line 265 of file predictor.hh.

Referenced by propagate_mdp_change(), propagate_reward_change(), propagate_transitions_change(), and ~State().
